question: “English men are more efficient partly by upbringing, partly by race and partly by education”. Who said this?
explanation: Lord Curzon said that English men are more efficient partly by upbringing, partly by race and partly by education. Lord Curzon – Governor General and Viceroy of India. Lord Curzon served as Governor General and Viceroy of India from 6 January 1899 to 18 November 1905. His policy resulted in deep discontent and the upsurge of a revolutionary movement in the country, due to which he can be called most unpopular Viceroy of India.
